c-1: ^Sorry Fred, I'll be back in a minute!

Start: ^Fred! My favorite little star, how are you?
^How did it go with Frank! What did you do? Tell me everything!
^You seem to be more excited about this than me...
^Well, I gave you advice, and I wanna know how it panned out!
^And as your friend, I am heavily invested in what happens to you!
^I was gonna make a joke but that's actualy just really nice!
^Let me get you a smoothie, and you prep your story!
^Alrighty, there you go! Now dish what happened!
^Well I don't really know where to start...
^We went and watched the shows you recommended after work!
^Yeah! He talked a lot about stuff I didn't really understand...
^That's awesome, Fred! And did you talk about school and the suit, or the whole adoption situation?
^Whenever I bring it up he goes quiet, and I don't know what to do.
^He seemed to be enjoying himself and talking about the characters he liked when he was growing up though
^(Damn, I don't know whether to praise the observation, or critize him avoiding the conversation...)
FredGoodEnd: ^That's actually really thoughtful of you, Fred!
^I love that you care about Frank so much, but if you're gonna move forward in your life you need to do it, right?
^If he says yes, you could instantly have a Dad who cares very deeply about you and who is willing and parently obiligated to help you with your situation.
^Giving him the benefit of the doubt, not knowing about your situation and caring enough to work basically 20 hours a day to help you...
^I think he could be a really great parent.
^He's really nice, and we like a lot of the same stuff too!
^Exactly! And think about it, he gets paid.
^So long as he's somewhat responsible with his money, he should be able to pay for you to go to school.
^And you can make friends your own age!
^What do you do think? What would you wanna do first?

c-0: ^I think it would be nice to work with Frank more.
^As long as you don't have to work to pay off the suit, that is.
^I think I understand that's a bad thing now...
^Never let them take advantage of you again! Especially now with Frank in your corner, you should be untouchable by those corporate bastards!
^You called them "bastards" a few times now... What does that mean?
^Learn from Frank, not me when it comes to words, hun.
^Our language hasn't evolved to be understanding of others in hundreds of years...
^So don't repeat the words I say.
^Okay, so I should keep working with Frank as long as I get money for it?
c-1: ^A lot of my coworkers never went to school, but they got jobs anyways...
^Well, it's not needed for UMS jobs...
^BUT! It's still important you go for the social aspect!
^You can make friends, talk to people of all different cultures, planets, realms, planes of existence, and even other dimensions!

^Plus, you can learn about anything you want! If you want to learn more about stars you can do that! You can even learn about history, languages, math, though that's not really fun for most people, anything you want to at all!
^Okay! If you think it's the right thing to do, I don't see why not!
^Well, you can also ask Frank about it and he'll agree with me, I'm 99% sure!
^Don't worry about it, it's just a saying.
^But isn't that math? I thought you didn't like math?
^You are going to make some poor underpaid teacher's day with all these questions.
^Okay! So once I go to school, what do I do after that?
c-2: ^Fred, you've been working for hundreds of years!
^Most kids don't work 'til they're older, or have had some sort of education or learned a trade.
^You could do whatever you want for a few years, to relax after working for a suit you should have paid off hundreds of years ago!
^You could watch cartoons, play with other kids, go out and talk with people whenever you want, eat whatever you want, go wherever you want...
^It very much is Fred! You missed out on a lot of kid shenanigans--Might not be a bad idea to enjoy life with Frank for a little bit!
^Earth has some great Theme parks and carnivals you could go to!
^Massive thruster propelled carts that shoot you around the sky, using only small metal railings to keep you in place on a winding track...
^Well it is in concept, but it's actually really fun when you try it!
^Some even go to the moon and back!
^See! And you and Frank could bond over all that, and make some really nice memories!
^You seem to think it's fun, so I think it will be, too!
^(I feel like a proud teacher whose student is graduating...)
^But after all the coasters and parks, what do I after?

FredChaosEnd: ^Well, when are you planning on asking him?
^Well, do you still want to ask him?
^You're worrying me my little clueless star... Speak in more than three words please...
^Well, I had fun with him, right?
^Yes? I feel a "but" coming after that...
^But what you said earlier got me thinking...
^Well, do you remember what you first said me to when I mentioned Frank worked with me before?

c-0: ^How long you had worked with each other?
^And I thought about it a little...
^And he's been nice for a while.
^It's been a while that he's been doing this...
^He hasn't tried to help outside of being nice to me for hundreds of years...
^Hasn't even brought up UMS using me once...
^But there was one person that did, as soon as they heard about it happening...
c-1: ^Hey, I talk a lot, it could be just about anything!
^What you said about him working with me...?
^When you asked me how old I was ?
^You also asked how old he was?
^Sounds like a reasonable question for me to ask, your honor.
^You asked how long we knew each other?
^And during that time, how long we knew of each other?
^Well yes, "Miss Thorough," you mentioned we worked together for a long time?
^And he had all that time to try and get closer with me if he wanted to...?
^Why thank you, my good star sir!
^Ha, someone's picked up a little sass, have we?
^Oh no, I'm a problem it seems!
^And your point is, smarty suit pants?
^Only one sassy person has tried to help me out of this...
c-2: ^Help a gal out here, little star.
^Yes, you said that, but Frank's time at UMS.
^It's just as long if not longer than mine...
^but he said nothing during that time
^Nothing about me, nothing about the suit--He just helped me learn how to do things by myself.
^Okay, I see now. And this brings us to you feeling bad about Frank?
^I still really care what he has done for me...
^But he didn't try and fix anything, just make it more bearable.
^Only one person really tried to change my life...

FredBadEnd: ^Even if he says no, it's better knowing.
^Just remember, even if he ends up being a dead end for adoption, it's still better to ask now versus later, so you can find someone to help you sooner than later.
^And that way you aren't stuck working at UMS for another hundred years, getting paid nothing for wearing a suit that does nothing.
^I mean yeah, but I don't know...
^Everything you've been saying has kinda been making sense...
^The work thing, UMS is sadly my life right now...
^And I'm not sure I want that.
^But I don't know if he's worth spending all my time working at UMS.
^And remember what I said a few days ago, you have other options for people that care for you, and it's better to leave UMS and that whole suit business behind anyways!
^Nothing good will come from working for a corporation that doesn't value you as a person.
^But speaking of caring for you, did find out more about the two mysterious people you mentioned before?
^I don't know if they like me enough to adopt me.
^But I know I don't want to work at UMS for much longer!
^The more you talk about them using me, the more I notice things they say at work are bad!
^And you're right, this suit isn't my world.
^Even if it is fun to wear, I can get another one, right?!
^What do you think it should be?
GoodFinal: ^After you're done with everything you want, I'll always be here for bits of amazing life changing advice, and Frank will be there to take care of you!
^Don't worry about your entire future now! Enjoy the present and do whatever you think is best, even if you choose wrong, you will have thousands of chances to choose right in your life, little star.
^And what happens if I don't have enough time to visit, or if Frank takes me somewhere else?
^Well Fred, here at O'Ryan's Diner we have a saying, do you know what that is?
^No matter where you are or what you desire, we are just a wormhole away!
^Thanks Graciana! I think I had a lot of fun talking to you!
^Me too, little star. Make sure you visit every so often to keep me up to date on how you're doing, alright?
^Well I have to go tell Frank the good news, and ask him a very important question!
^(Fred gives me a quick hug before running off towards the portal, and diving head first into the swirling vortex that leads to UMS headquarters)
^Shit I'm going to miss that kid
^(Stares off into the distance as a Ums ship soars past the diner in the distance)
^I'm really going to miss that little star
^(a few months go by before a tall lanky figure in a Ums uniform comes in asking for you by name)
^(his presence is somewhat mysterious and you feel certain there is something strange about him)

^(But he carries a gentle smile and a relaxed tone as he thanks you for helping Fred and he steps to the side to reveal Fred holding a sign that says Part time Certified UMS Employee, Student, and full time Fred.)
ChaosFinal: ^I have a strong feeling I'm gonna turn around and see no one behind me, but I'm going to do it anyway to be absolutely sure I get what you're putting down, little man
^(Shit, no one's there, he's for sure suggesting I could be his mom...)
^(Shit, I mean I thought about it before right? Right? It's perfectly fine if I do?)
^(I never really wanted kids, but he wouldn't really be like having a baby, because I'm skipping the painful part of finding a partner first...)
^(I mean I have a job, I could help pay off his suit and get him out of his contract with UMS...)
^(I could also take care of him after work and on weekends)
^Do not repeat any of what I just said outloud, those are Earthly customs to be used when frustrated or when someone cuts you off in interdimensional traffic.
^This is the weirdest sentence I have ever thought of, or probably uttered outloud... But...
^Do you want me to be your mom?!
^You can be my teacher, mother, caretaker, main source of income--
^Hey now, that last part we gotta talk about.
^Damn right I am, my little star.
^The legal process is easy I think, it's just a matter of fixing your situation with UMS.
^Woooooo! I'm going to be just like you!
^I can work in the diner, talk to people about their problems all day, serve food, make friends, go to school--
^Let me clean up and then lets go see your new home, bud.

c-0: ^Oh, they used to be the apex predators of the Northern Icy planes of Earth, until Penguins evovled to hunt in packs and started hunting them.
^But they're really cute and fluffy! I think you could pull it off!
^Yeah, and think, no one else would be wearing one, so you would be one of a kind!
^But that still leaves me with a question...
c-1: ^Frogs? I thought people didn't like them because they're gross and slimey...
^But most frogs are small cute little hopping green buddies!
^I used to have a pet frog when I was little named Big Stinky!
^Why did you name it Big Stinky?
^Well, he would always stare at me all day while I played at home with a... "Stinky eye" kind of look.
^So I called em Big Stinky because of it, and he didn't seem to mind.
^But still, a cute little hopping amphibian!
^And you think my suit would look good as a frog?
^I guess that only leaves the other big question...
^And what would that be, little hopping star?
c-2: ^Well I think you would look adorable in a puppy suit!
^You're already a loyal and adorable little star who everyone loves to be around, so it would fit the bill!
^Oh, right, that probably doesn't make sense to you yet.
^It would make sense for someone as outgoing and innocent as you to be a puppy!
^Hmmm, I think I get what you're saying...

BadEndingFinal: ^Oh, good point, a new activity would be useful to plan out before you quit...
^Well hun, love ya to death, but I don't know if you should be working at your age.
^I know you're older than you look, but still, it doesn't feel right for you to be going from job to job.
^There are a lot of public schools on Earth, I'm sure they wouldn't mind having you there!
^Think of all the friends you could make!
^I haven't really learned a whole lot, besides how to properly make package seals and delivery things places.
^And making friends my age could be really fun!
^Well, around your age, but yeah! I think it could be great for you!
^Okay so school on earth after I quit UMS...
^Well, normally you need two weeks notice, and need to tell your boss...
^Well, I guess if you aren't getting paid anyways, you could just leave without saying anything and drop the suit off before you leave.
^Oh yeah! I could fart in it too before I leave, so the next person who wears it will face my Cosmos!
^That's certainly something that you could do...
^One last "screw you" towards UMS would be fun!
^Okay, so do you want to take off the suit after you finish your drink?
^I'm going to enjoy my swirl through my own two hands
^For too long have I been oppressed into drinking juice through tubes!
^Oh boy, I can tell you've been watching some of the darker cartoons...
^Yeah, even Frank closed his eyes at some parts...
^Screw UMS, screw this Suit, and screw being forced to make friends while giving them stuff!
^I'll only make friends with people who I want to talk to from now on!
^(Fred puts his hands on the helmet, and swiftly pulls it off--)
^(A blinding white light fills the Diner...)
^(The suit is on the ground in front of me all torn to shreds, safe for the helmet...)
^(I look out the window of the Diner...)
^(A new constellation... Staring back at me...?)
monday: ^I didn't think Mondays were busy, though...
^Well, time to unlock tha portal, ya?
tuesday: ^Ya ever wake up and think, "ah man, I coulda been famous!"
^Well, I don't! I love it here! Ahahaha!
^Another Tuesday in tha kitchen, surrounded by food!
^...I wish I had your optimism, Chef...
^Ay, time to unlock the portal. Ya ready, Graciana?
wednesday: ^Somethin' feels off. Like, tha energy of tha food is screamin' at me...
^There's somethin' I tell ya... Somethin' goin' on...
^Go an' open up tha portal, ya?
thursday: ^Ay, had a long night of cookin'...
^Nothin' in particular, was just experimentin' with some stuff.
^...You stayed up all night for that? On a Thursday?
^Ya. Why wouldn't I? I had a lot of ideas!
friday: ^We got a big day ahead of us!
^Fridays get busy, an' CeCe ain't here.
^Good! 'Cause I'ma be stuck in the kitchen all day!
^Aight! let's crack open the portal and get rockin'!
saturday: ^Saturdays are busy too, huh? That makes sense.
^Ay, very! Another day in the kitchen for me!
^Ay, unlock the portal and let's get crackin'!
